title: 2.8 Lost Books of the New Testaments
itunes:title: Lost Books of the New Testaments
description: Jews produced a vast number of religious books in the centuries before the birth of Jesus. They had no influence on later Judaism, but profoundly influenced Christianity. We call them parabiblical or pseudipigraphical. Their significance was not appreciated until the discoveries of the Dead Sea Scrolls.
content:encoded: Jews produced a vast number of religious books in the centuries before the birth of Jesus. They had no influence on later Judaism, but profoundly influenced Christianity. We call them parabiblical or pseudipigraphical. Their significance was not appreciated until the discoveries of the Dead Sea Scrolls.
itunes:subtitle: Keynote ep: Christianity's origins in the lost books of the Second Temple
itunes:author: Garry Stevens
